messages.content: What is the purpose of the comfyui-random-node?
The purpose of the comfyui-random-node is to shuffle nodes after they have been added to the queue in ComfyUI.
How can the comfyui-random-node be added to a ComfyUI workflow?
To add the comfyui-random-node to a ComfyUI workflow, go to 'Add node' and navigate to 'utils' and then select 'Random Node'.
Is there a visual guide available for using the comfyui-random-node?
Yes, there is a visual guide available for using the comfyui-random-node. It can be found in the 'images' folder and is titled 'example.gif'.
What is the significance of the 'workflow.png' image in the comfyui-random-node documentation?

The 'workflow.png' image in the comfyui-random-node documentation visually represents the node's function within a ComfyUI workflow, showcasing its ability to shuffle nodes after they have been added to the queue.
Is the comfyui-random-node part of any specific ComfyUI package?
The documentation does not specify if the comfyui-random-node is part of any specific ComfyUI package. However, it does reference the 'ComfyUI-Inspire-Pack' in the 'References' section.
